alert.note: Alert for Humboldt; Pocahontas (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued June 24 at 11:02PM CDT until June 24 at 11:45PM CDT by NWS DesMoines
info.description: The National Weather Service in Des Moines has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Northeastern Pocahontas County in northwestern Iowa... Western Humboldt County in north central Iowa... * Until 1145 PM CDT. * At 1102 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Pocahontas Municipal Airport, or over Pocahontas, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This dangerous storm will be near... Rolfe around 1120 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this tornadic thunderstorm include Gilmore City and Bradgate. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
